context: The Estonian word 'lahe' has multiple meanings depending on context. As an adjective, it means cool/awesome/good/pleasant/comfortable/friendly/spacious/light/easy/fresh when used informally. It can also be a noun meaning fork/bifurcation or junction point (like in roads or weather systems). This analysis focuses on the informal adjective usage which is similar to English 'cool' or 'awesome'. The word comes from Proto-Finnic origins and has cognates in related languages.
